alert.note: Alert for Loess Plains (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 29 at 2:53AM CDT until April 29 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING FOR FIRE ZONE 219... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES AND STRONG WINDS... The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM CDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zone 219. * TIMING...Noon until 8 PM CDT Saturday. * WIND...North with gusts to 45mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and be very difficult to control. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
